Sentencas: La0.90Sr0.10Ga0.85Mg0.15O3-delta (LSGM) was prepared by solid state synthesis and mixed with various amounts of Ni and NiO, respectively.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of strontium and magnesium substituted lanthanum gallate-nickel cermet anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The optimum sintering temperature of the material was identified by dilatometric studies to be above 1300 degrees C.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of strontium and magnesium substituted lanthanum gallate-nickel cermet anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The interaction between LSGM and NiO was studied by X-ray diffraction after sintering at 1300 and 1400 degrees C in air as well as after reduction in hydrogen atmosphere at 800 and 1000 degrees C. The LaSrGa3O7 compound was detected after sintering, whereas, LaSrGaO4 was found after reduction treatment of the material.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of strontium and magnesium substituted lanthanum gallate-nickel cermet anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Diffusion of Ni into LSGM was thought to be the reason for the presence of the above mentioned phases.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of strontium and magnesium substituted lanthanum gallate-nickel cermet anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: After the treatment, LSGM contained 2.3 at% of Ni determined by energy dispersive X-ray analysis (EDX).
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of strontium and magnesium substituted lanthanum gallate-nickel cermet anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The thermal expansion coefficient of LSGM with varying contents of Ni was observed to increase with increasing the Ni content.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of strontium and magnesium substituted lanthanum gallate-nickel cermet anode for solid oxide fuel cells
Synthesis and characterization of strontium and magnesium substituted lanthanum gallate-nickel cermet anode for solid oxide fuel cells
